126.title_api: Football meets philosophy in Kaliningrad, hometown of Kant
126.caption_api: In this photo taken on Thursday, June 21, 2018, Serbia fans sit outside the Kaliningrad Cathedral, which houses a museum dedicated to Immanuel Kant, in Kaliningrad, Russia. In Kaliningrad, a small Russian outpost sandwiched between Poland, Lithuania and the Baltic Sea, philosophy and football are coming together as fans troop through a small museum dedicated to the city and one of its most famous residents - Immanuel Kant. The German philosopher who died in 1804 lived most of his life in Kaliningrad when it was the German city of Koenigsberg - it became part of the Soviet Union after World War II and now serves as an important Russian naval base and is home to a university named for Kant. (AP Photo/Michael Corder)
126.desc_api: Football meets philosophy in Kaliningrad, hometown of Kant

151.title_api: Column: Video refereeing a boon and a bust at World Cup
151.caption_api: Referee Andres Cunha from Uruguay blows his whistle and indicates that VAR had shown that Iran’s Morteza Pouraliganji had handled the ball into the net, and no goal was givenduring the group B match between Iran and Spain at the 2018 soccer World Cup in the Kazan Arena in Kazan, Russia, Wednesday, June 20, 2018. (AP Photo/Sergei Grits)
151.desc_api: Column: Video refereeing a boon and a bust at World Cup

152.title_api: El Hadary sets record; Saudis beat Egypt, 2-1, at World Cup
152.caption_api: Egypt goalkeeper Essam El Hadary, 45, looks on during A Group A match against Saudi Arabia at the 2018 soccer World Cup in Volgograd, Russia, on Monday. Egypt lost, 2-1.
152.desc_api: The oldest person to play in a World Cup soccer match let in a pair of goals Monday despite some spectacular saves.

153.title_api: Iran hopes for respect after stopping Ronaldo at World Cup
153.caption_api: Iran goalkeeper Ali Beiranvand makes a save during the group B match between Iran and Portugal at the 2018 soccer World Cup at the Mordovia Arena in Saransk, Russia, Monday, June 25, 2018. (AP Photo/Pavel Golovkin)
153.desc_api: Iran hopes for respect after stopping Ronaldo at World Cup

154.title_api: Quaresma gets some playing time, and a goal for Portugal
154.caption_api: Portugal’s Ricardo Quaresma lies on the ground after a clash with Iran’s Saeid Ezatolahi as hand are offered to help him up during the group B match between Iran and Portugal at the 2018 soccer World Cup at the Mordovia Arena in Saransk, Russia, Monday, June 25, 2018. (AP Photo/Francisco Seco)
154.desc_api: Quaresma gets some playing time, and a goal for Portugal

155.title_api: Iran coach Queiroz again lashes out at video review
155.caption_api: Iran head coach Carlos Queiroz prior to the group B match between Iran and Portugal at the 2018 soccer World Cup at the Mordovia Arena in Saransk, Russia, Monday, June 25, 2018. (AP Photo/Pavel Golovkin)
155.desc_api: Iran coach Queiroz again lashes out at video review

156.title_api: Ronaldo misses penalty; Portugal draws, 1-1, with Iran
156.caption_api: Iran goalkeeper Ali Beiranvand stops Cristiano Ronaldo on a penalty kick Monday. The Portugal star has now missed six of his last 14 penalty kicks. The teams played to a 1-1 draw.
156.desc_api: Cristiano Ronaldo’s missed penalty cost Portugal first place in its World Cup soccer group.

157.title_api: Spain draws 2-2 with Morocco, reaches World Cup round of 16
157.caption_api: Spain’s Sergio Ramos, right, falls, losing his shoe, after a tackle by Morocco’s Noureddine Amrabat, left, during a Group B match at the 2018 soccer World Cup in Kaliningrad, Russia, on Monday. The teams played to a 2-2 draw.
157.desc_api: A video replay in injury time gave Spain the goal it needed to win Group B at soccer’s World Cup.
